ovdesc.p: The purpose of this table is to indicate the public holidays for each Country, or Region within a Country, for the calendar years over which the bank's current business is spread.

The User must indicate, for each Country or Region, the public holidays and which day(s) of the week make up the weekend. The non-working weekend days are then generated automatically for the year and for this reason they do not have to be specified individually as public holidays.

Each T24 Application will refer to this table during input validation to verify that any dates entered by the User are working days or to force an override to accept non-working days. It is also used to determine the delivery date, by taking non-working days into consideration.
The REGION and COUNTRY tables must be set up before this table can be created.

desc.p: Shows which days in the month are working days and which are non-working days.
31 type AAA (alpha) characters, one for each day of the month, W = working day H = non-working day X = non-existent day, e.g. February 30th (Internal field, no input.)
Identifies the non-working weekend days for the Country/Region.
Note : When a new record is input, field will show SA and SU automatically which can be overwritten.
(Multivalue field)
(Optional input)
This field allows all weekend days to be automatically calculated for the Country/Region and year specified in Field 0.
Note: When the user wants to define a single day week end (such as the Friday in the Middle East countries), he will then need to eliminate one multivalue field (Field 13.2).
2 type SSS (uppercase alpha) characters: MO = Monday TU = Tuesday WE = Wednesday TH = Thursday FR = Friday SA = Saturday SU = Sunday

Identifies the public Holidays for March in the specified Country/Region and year.
This field identifies all public Holidays for March in the Country/Region and year specified in Field 0. Weekends will not be included here.
For example:
If the Holidays were on the 1st, 4th, 20th and 26th input would be 01 04 20 26.
A maximum of 12 Holidays can be defined for each month in addition to weekends, and they can be input in any order.
Up to 35 characters made up of 2 numeric character day numbers from 01-31 followed by a space. (Optional input)
It must be a valid day for March.
Duplicate day numbers are not allowed.

Identifies the Holiday details.
This code is used to identify where and when the Holidays apply.
2 type SSS (uppercase alpha) character Country code, 1-2 numeric character Region code and 4 numeric character year from 1950-2049. (Mandatory input. Region code optional, default value 00.)
If Region code entered, Country and Region code must be an existing record on the REGION table.
If Region code not entered, Country code must be an existing record on the COUNTRY table.
